title: 19 Best Kids’ Furniture Stores and Our Favorite Picks
description: For babies, toddlers, teens, and every age in between
author: Shoko Wanger, Julia Harrison
excerpt: For babies, toddlers, teens, and every age in between, we've rounded up the best kids furniture stores around–and selected standout products to get you started.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.As any design-minded parent can attest, the Internet rabbit hole that is finding the best kids’ furniture is real and it is deep. With a wide range of retailers catering to every style, age, and price point, the options can seem endless—and so can the list of boxes these items are expected to tick: Are they well-made? Non-toxic?Enticing enough to delight a preschooler and meet the standards of their fault-finding parent? It’s enough to boggle an already overloaded mind. To ease the stress of the never-ending scroll, we’ve put together a list of our favorite home decor destinations for furnishing nurseries, kids’ rooms, and playrooms that deliver on child-friendly charm and functionality alike. There still may be a sea of bunk beds, bean bags, and adorable animal-shaped bookcases to navigate in the quest for the best kids’ furniture, but rest assured, in these well-curated waters, you’d be hard pressed to steer astray.Best for Quality Kids’ Furniture: West Elm KidsMost Stylish Options: Crate & KidsBest for Bespoke Details: EtsyBest for Bunk Beds: WayfairBest for Teen Furniture: Pottery Barn Kids & Pottery Barn TeenBest Storage Options: Amazon1. West Elm KidsA long-standing staple for modern furnishings and decor, West Elm offers a smorgasbord of affordable children’s pieces that range from midcentury-modern bedroom furniture (including kid-size tables, desk chairs, and design-your-own storage systems) to indoor playhouses. Other pluses: The company is a proponent of sustainable, fair trade production and regularly partners with independent artists and designers on exclusive releases. A recent collection with Eva Chen includes playful (and injury-avoidant!) bullnose pieces, as well as a butter yellow, baby blue, and dark teal color story we love.Catching our eye:West Elm Kids Belle Kids NightstandEva Chen Arched Reading Nook w/ Bookcase2. Crate & KidsAs its name suggests, this popular retailer brings Crate & Barrel’s modern, high-quality design sensibilities to a comprehensive range of furniture and decor for kids. Here, you’ll find everything from bestselling Jenny Lind bed frames and nightstands to elevated takes on nursery classics: cribs, gliders, changing tables, and toy storage. Crate & Kids also offers a broad lineup of toys and baby gear, making it a true one-stop shop for both necessities and gifts.Catching our eye:Wooden Kids Art EaselCrate&kids Canyon Natural Wood Wide 3-Shelf Bookcase by Leanne Ford3. EtsyUnearthing the perfect find may require a bit of digging, but any seasoned Etsy shopper will tell you that the added effort comes with its own reward. A seemingly limitless treasure trove of handmade and vintage items, the site is packed with one of a kind gems that can’t be found anywhere else. Look for handmade kids’ furniture, colorful vintage rugs, unique wall art, and all manner of head-turning decor at every possible price point.Catching our eye:KidooCrafts House Bed with Drawer For KidsPersonalized Puzzle Stool4. WayfairWayfair has a wide and affordable selection of kids bedroom furniture, but they’re an especially great resource for both practical and whimsical bed frames for your little one. They have hundreds of options for whatever your vision might be—platform beds, trundle beds, and twin bunk beds to name a few. To maximize longevity, we recommend their variety of solid wood options. With quality materials, one bed can last from kindergarten through the inevitable ninth-grade ask for a full upgrade.Catching our eye:Avdain Full Solid Wood Panel Bed with TrundleBrodey Twin Platform Bed5. Pottery Barn Kids and Pottery Barn TeenThese two Pottery Barn offshoots mirror the stately silhouettes and classic character of the original store, with many pieces recalling designs of the past: the Ava Regency collection, with its curves and decorative molding, references Old Hollywood, while the Juliette collection draws inspiration from the look of a vintage cottage. Others offer solutions for furnishing small spaces, with an emphasis on clever, built-in storage—this multitasking loft bed, for instance, is also a desk, dresser, bookshelf in one tidy package.Catching our eye:Pottery Barn Kids Milo NightstandTweed Charcoal Modern Lounger6. TargetThough Target’s in-house kids’ brand, Pillowfort, offers plenty in the way of colorful, kid-friendly wares, many of its affordable grown-up furnishings—especially those produced in collaboration with designers like Shea McGee of Studio McGee and Justina Blakeney of Jungalow—would be equally at home in a child’s room or nursery. Notably, Target also carries a sensory-friendly kids’ collection, including velvet cocoon seats, rocking desk chairs, and foam-filled crash pads.Catching our eye:Pom Pom Kids' Tent Pink - Pillowfort™Opalhouse Maddalena Mushroom Stool by Jungalow7. MaisonetteWith offerings from over 800 brands around the world, Maisonette’s mom-founded marketplace allows shoppers to peruse kids’ furniture and decor from well-known names like Babyletto, KidKraft, and Nursery Works—as well as top international brands and boutique labels—all in one site. With two former Vogue staffers at the helm, its selection is as chic as it is expansive (for those unsure of where to start, there are curated buying guides available for browsing).Catching our eye:Fantasy Fields by Teamson Kids Monet Play Art TablePoppie Rattan Bunny Chair8. AmazonOne of our favorite kids furniture collabs right now is on Amazon, courtesy of DaVinci and kid’s fashion brand Carter’s. The brands have teamed up to create a line of high quality nursery furniture with classic designs. The pieces are made of solid wood, which provide a canvas that gets cute with the details but avoids creating an overwhelming space in a room that, let’s face it, is often going to feel a bit chaotic.Catching our eye:Carter's by DaVinci Colby 4-in-1 Low-Profile Convertible CribDaVinci Colby 3-Drawer Dresser9. Serena & LilyKnown for its easy elegance, Serena + Lily imbues kids’ bedrooms and nurseries with the spirit of a beach vacation, regardless of where they may be located. Expect to find swivel gliders in airy white linen, cribs and dressers accented with handwoven caning, and daybeds made from honey-toned rattan. Even more aww-inducing: A scaled-down version of the brand’s classic bistro chair, for mini gourmands who prefer their snacks al fresco.Catching our eye:Serena & Lily Kids' Venice Rattan ChairSerena & Lily Grady Swivel Glider - Skirted10. Design Within ReachThough it may not be the first retailer you’d think of when it comes to kids’ spaces, Design Within Reach’s expansive collection of modern home furnishings has more than a few options suitable for the grade school set. And while its higher prices might add up to a splurge, its timeless appeal and exceptional quality means you’ll be investing in pieces that’ll have a treasured place in your home for a lifetime—or at least long after your child decides to take room design into their own hands.Catching our eye:Componibili Bio Storage Unit by KartellHerman Miller Eames Hang-It-All11. OeufA family-run company based in Brooklyn, Oeuf has long been beloved for its playful, artisan-made kids’ furniture and clothing. Turns out the brand’s production standards are as laudable as their heirloom-quality designs: Everything on offer—from Greenguard Gold certified cribs, toddler beds, and bunk beds to irresistibly offbeat pillows, rugs, and stuffed animals—is sustainably made using fair trade practices. They’re also crafted by hand with materials like responsibly sourced wood, hand-loomed wool, and organic cotton.Catching our eye:Oeuf Sparrow CribOeuf Mini Library12. NestigRelative newcomer Nestig offers sustainably produced kids’ furniture with playful, imaginative flair: think cribs in dreamy pastel colors and bookshelves in the shape of sailboats and starships. Beyond those larger staples, the brand stocks a plentiful array of accessories and decor, including organic quilts, washable rugs, and vibrant, Greenguard Gold certified wallpaper and murals.Catching our eye:Nestig The Candy Cloud CribNestig Pier Wall Mural13. ecoBirdyBuilt entirely from recycled plastic toys, this Belgian line of child-size tables and chairs is suffused with fun to its core. With confetti colors and an appealing blocky design (buffered by rounded edges), these statement pieces are easy to clean and light enough to be moved from playroom to patio without a hitch. (Rest assured, envious adults: The company makes grown-up versions, too, in neutral colorways.)Catching our eye:Charlie Chair by ecoBirdyRhino Lamp Bulb14. Ferm LivingCopenhagen-based Ferm Living offers high-quality children’s furniture, rugs, wallpaper, and toy storage that’s both cheery and sophisticated, minimal but completely magical. Imagine adult-friendly pieces, but with a childlike twist: clean-lined desks and chairs in bright primary hues, camel-colored cushion covers dotted with fluffy yarn pom poms, and roomy braided baskets that borrow inspiration from the fruit bowl.Catching our eye:Ferm Living Pear Bean BagFerm Living Up Step Stool15. Room + BoardIt’s no surprise that Minneapolis-based Room + Board—known for its polished designs and high-quality craftsmanship—makes children’s furniture defined by the same handsome elegance as its grown-up counterparts. We especially love its offerings for older kids and teens, which include bunk beds, loft beds, and a tasteful selection of bean bag chairs. After-school lounging never looked so luxe.Catching our eye:Quinn Rocking ChairRoom & Board Fort Bunk Bed16. NuggetPlush design, no sharp corners, and infinite methods of assembly, Nugget understands the importance of safely designed playtime. Their couch and ottoman are as amenable to fort-building as they are to Frozen-watching, easily storable and machine washable. Plus they come with a one-year warranty, just in case.Catching our eye:Nugget Original PlaycouchChunk Ottoman17. Charlie CraneUsing natural materials like beech, walnut, and organic cotton, this decade-old Parisian brand churns out thoughtful children’s pieces made to live harmoniously alongside stylish adult furnishings. Standout finds include a bar-less wooden crib that converts to a toddler bed, plywood shelves shaped like mountains and clouds, and an impossibly chic child-size chair that could easily hold its own in even the most exquisitely appointed living rooms.Catching our eye:Charlie Crane Popi Whale ShelfTami Playmat18. IKEAOver the years, we’ve made no secret of our admiration for IKEA’s endlessly adaptable kitchens, but the Scandi giant boasts an array of children’s furniture and decor that’s just as impressively versatile. From the purely practical (think sustainable solid beech cribs and child-height dressers), to the fairytale whimsical (leaf-shaped bed canopies and dollhouse shelving), IKEA delivers on its promise of quality design at a budget-friendly price point—but perhaps more importantly, its signature simplicity allows pieces to grow with a child and seamlessly fit any look.Catching our eye:IKEA Sniglar CribIKEA Poäng Kids Armchair19. OYOYWith the aim of recreating childhood memories, Danish brand OYOY turns out lighthearted designs that infuse practical items with the spirit of play. Many serve multiple purposes: Animal-shaped pillows double as ride-on toys, storage bins stand in as whimsical sculpture, wool and cotton rugs—featuring tufted croissants and ice cream cones—can alternately be displayed as wall hangings.Catching our eye:OYOY Croissant Tufted RugSally Snail
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

As any design-minded parent can attest, the Internet rabbit hole that is finding the best kids’ furniture is real and it is deep. With a wide range of retailers catering to every style, age, and price point, the options can seem endless—and so can the list of boxes these items are expected to tick: Are they well-made? Non-toxic?Enticing enough to delight a preschooler and meet the standards of their fault-finding parent? It’s enough to boggle an already overloaded mind. To ease the stress of the never-ending scroll, we’ve put together a list of our favorite home decor destinations for furnishing nurseries, kids’ rooms, and playrooms that deliver on child-friendly charm and functionality alike. There still may be a sea of bunk beds, bean bags, and adorable animal-shaped bookcases to navigate in the quest for the best kids’ furniture, but rest assured, in these well-curated waters, you’d be hard pressed to steer astray.

  • Best for Quality Kids’ Furniture: West Elm Kids
  • Most Stylish Options: Crate & Kids
  • Best for Bespoke Details: Etsy
  • Best for Bunk Beds: Wayfair
  • Best for Teen Furniture: Pottery Barn Kids & Pottery Barn Teen
  • Best Storage Options: Amazon

1. West Elm Kids

A long-standing staple for modern furnishings and decor, West Elm offers a smorgasbord of affordable children’s pieces that range from midcentury-modern bedroom furniture (including kid-size tables, desk chairs, and design-your-own storage systems) to indoor playhouses. Other pluses: The company is a proponent of sustainable, fair trade production and regularly partners with independent artists and designers on exclusive releases. A recent collection with Eva Chen includes playful (and injury-avoidant!) bullnose pieces, as well as a butter yellow, baby blue, and dark teal color story we love.

Catching our eye:

West Elm Kids Belle Kids Nightstand

Eva Chen Arched Reading Nook w/ Bookcase

2. Crate & Kids

As its name suggests, this popular retailer brings Crate & Barrel’s modern, high-quality design sensibilities to a comprehensive range of furniture and decor for kids. Here, you’ll find everything from bestselling Jenny Lind bed frames and nightstands to elevated takes on nursery classics: cribs, gliders, changing tables, and toy storage. Crate & Kids also offers a broad lineup of toys and baby gear, making it a true one-stop shop for both necessities and gifts.

Catching our eye:

Wooden Kids Art Easel

Crate&kids Canyon Natural Wood Wide 3-Shelf Bookcase by Leanne Ford

3. Etsy

Unearthing the perfect find may require a bit of digging, but any seasoned Etsy shopper will tell you that the added effort comes with its own reward. A seemingly limitless treasure trove of handmade and vintage items, the site is packed with one of a kind gems that can’t be found anywhere else. Look for handmade kids’ furniture, colorful vintage rugs, unique wall art, and all manner of head-turning decor at every possible price point.

Catching our eye:

KidooCrafts House Bed with Drawer For Kids

Personalized Puzzle Stool

4. Wayfair

Wayfair has a wide and affordable selection of kids bedroom furniture, but they’re an especially great resource for both practical and whimsical bed frames for your little one. They have hundreds of options for whatever your vision might be—platform beds, trundle beds, and twin bunk beds to name a few. To maximize longevity, we recommend their variety of solid wood options. With quality materials, one bed can last from kindergarten through the inevitable ninth-grade ask for a full upgrade.

Catching our eye:

Avdain Full Solid Wood Panel Bed with Trundle

Brodey Twin Platform Bed

5. Pottery Barn Kids and Pottery Barn Teen

These two Pottery Barn offshoots mirror the stately silhouettes and classic character of the original store, with many pieces recalling designs of the past: the Ava Regency collection, with its curves and decorative molding, references Old Hollywood, while the Juliette collection draws inspiration from the look of a vintage cottage. Others offer solutions for furnishing small spaces, with an emphasis on clever, built-in storage—this multitasking loft bed, for instance, is also a desk, dresser, bookshelf in one tidy package.

Catching our eye:

Pottery Barn Kids Milo Nightstand

Tweed Charcoal Modern Lounger

6. Target

Though Target’s in-house kids’ brand, Pillowfort, offers plenty in the way of colorful, kid-friendly wares, many of its affordable grown-up furnishings—especially those produced in collaboration with designers like Shea McGee of Studio McGee and Justina Blakeney of Jungalow—would be equally at home in a child’s room or nursery. Notably, Target also carries a sensory-friendly kids’ collection, including velvet cocoon seats, rocking desk chairs, and foam-filled crash pads.

Catching our eye:

Pom Pom Kids' Tent Pink - Pillowfort™

Opalhouse Maddalena Mushroom Stool by Jungalow

7. Maisonette

With offerings from over 800 brands around the world, Maisonette’s mom-founded marketplace allows shoppers to peruse kids’ furniture and decor from well-known names like Babyletto, KidKraft, and Nursery Works—as well as top international brands and boutique labels—all in one site. With two former Vogue staffers at the helm, its selection is as chic as it is expansive (for those unsure of where to start, there are curated buying guides available for browsing).

Catching our eye:

Fantasy Fields by Teamson Kids Monet Play Art Table

Poppie Rattan Bunny Chair

8. Amazon

One of our favorite kids furniture collabs right now is on Amazon, courtesy of DaVinci and kid’s fashion brand Carter’s. The brands have teamed up to create a line of high quality nursery furniture with classic designs. The pieces are made of solid wood, which provide a canvas that gets cute with the details but avoids creating an overwhelming space in a room that, let’s face it, is often going to feel a bit chaotic.

Catching our eye:

Carter's by DaVinci Colby 4-in-1 Low-Profile Convertible Crib

DaVinci Colby 3-Drawer Dresser

9. Serena & Lily

Known for its easy elegance, Serena + Lily imbues kids’ bedrooms and nurseries with the spirit of a beach vacation, regardless of where they may be located. Expect to find swivel gliders in airy white linen, cribs and dressers accented with handwoven caning, and daybeds made from honey-toned rattan. Even more aww-inducing: A scaled-down version of the brand’s classic bistro chair, for mini gourmands who prefer their snacks al fresco.

Catching our eye:

Serena & Lily Kids' Venice Rattan Chair

Serena & Lily Grady Swivel Glider - Skirted

10. Design Within Reach

Though it may not be the first retailer you’d think of when it comes to kids’ spaces, Design Within Reach’s expansive collection of modern home furnishings has more than a few options suitable for the grade school set. And while its higher prices might add up to a splurge, its timeless appeal and exceptional quality means you’ll be investing in pieces that’ll have a treasured place in your home for a lifetime—or at least long after your child decides to take room design into their own hands.

Catching our eye:

Componibili Bio Storage Unit by Kartell

Herman Miller Eames Hang-It-All

11. Oeuf

A family-run company based in Brooklyn, Oeuf has long been beloved for its playful, artisan-made kids’ furniture and clothing. Turns out the brand’s production standards are as laudable as their heirloom-quality designs: Everything on offer—from Greenguard Gold certified cribs, toddler beds, and bunk beds to irresistibly offbeat pillows, rugs, and stuffed animals—is sustainably made using fair trade practices. They’re also crafted by hand with materials like responsibly sourced wood, hand-loomed wool, and organic cotton.

Catching our eye:

Oeuf Sparrow Crib

Oeuf Mini Library

12. Nestig

Relative newcomer Nestig offers sustainably produced kids’ furniture with playful, imaginative flair: think cribs in dreamy pastel colors and bookshelves in the shape of sailboats and starships. Beyond those larger staples, the brand stocks a plentiful array of accessories and decor, including organic quilts, washable rugs, and vibrant, Greenguard Gold certified wallpaper and murals.

Catching our eye:

Nestig The Candy Cloud Crib

Nestig Pier Wall Mural

13. ecoBirdy

Built entirely from recycled plastic toys, this Belgian line of child-size tables and chairs is suffused with fun to its core. With confetti colors and an appealing blocky design (buffered by rounded edges), these statement pieces are easy to clean and light enough to be moved from playroom to patio without a hitch. (Rest assured, envious adults: The company makes grown-up versions, too, in neutral colorways.)

Catching our eye:

Charlie Chair by ecoBirdy

Rhino Lamp Bulb

14. Ferm Living

Copenhagen-based Ferm Living offers high-quality children’s furniture, rugs, wallpaper, and toy storage that’s both cheery and sophisticated, minimal but completely magical. Imagine adult-friendly pieces, but with a childlike twist: clean-lined desks and chairs in bright primary hues, camel-colored cushion covers dotted with fluffy yarn pom poms, and roomy braided baskets that borrow inspiration from the fruit bowl.

Catching our eye:

Ferm Living Pear Bean Bag

Ferm Living Up Step Stool

15. Room + Board

It’s no surprise that Minneapolis-based Room + Board—known for its polished designs and high-quality craftsmanship—makes children’s furniture defined by the same handsome elegance as its grown-up counterparts. We especially love its offerings for older kids and teens, which include bunk beds, loft beds, and a tasteful selection of bean bag chairs. After-school lounging never looked so luxe.

Catching our eye:

Quinn Rocking Chair

Room & Board Fort Bunk Bed

16. Nugget

Plush design, no sharp corners, and infinite methods of assembly, Nugget understands the importance of safely designed playtime. Their couch and ottoman are as amenable to fort-building as they are to Frozen-watching, easily storable and machine washable. Plus they come with a one-year warranty, just in case.

Catching our eye:

Nugget Original Playcouch

Chunk Ottoman

17. Charlie Crane

Using natural materials like beech, walnut, and organic cotton, this decade-old Parisian brand churns out thoughtful children’s pieces made to live harmoniously alongside stylish adult furnishings. Standout finds include a bar-less wooden crib that converts to a toddler bed, plywood shelves shaped like mountains and clouds, and an impossibly chic child-size chair that could easily hold its own in even the most exquisitely appointed living rooms.

Catching our eye:

Charlie Crane Popi Whale Shelf

Tami Playmat

18. IKEA

Over the years, we’ve made no secret of our admiration for IKEA’s endlessly adaptable kitchens, but the Scandi giant boasts an array of children’s furniture and decor that’s just as impressively versatile. From the purely practical (think sustainable solid beech cribs and child-height dressers), to the fairytale whimsical (leaf-shaped bed canopies and dollhouse shelving), IKEA delivers on its promise of quality design at a budget-friendly price point—but perhaps more importantly, its signature simplicity allows pieces to grow with a child and seamlessly fit any look.

Catching our eye:

IKEA Sniglar Crib

IKEA Poäng Kids Armchair

19. OYOY

With the aim of recreating childhood memories, Danish brand OYOY turns out lighthearted designs that infuse practical items with the spirit of play. Many serve multiple purposes: Animal-shaped pillows double as ride-on toys, storage bins stand in as whimsical sculpture, wool and cotton rugs—featuring tufted croissants and ice cream cones—can alternately be displayed as wall hangings.

Catching our eye:

OYOY Croissant Tufted Rug

Sally Snail
